thread.title: The U.S. Mint Has Finally Put a Black Woman on a Coin, But You Probably Won't Ever See It
thread.title_full: The U.S. Mint Has Finally Put a Black Woman on a Coin, But You Probably Won't Ever See It

author: khal
title: The U.S. Mint Has Finally Put a Black Woman on a Coin, But You Probably Won't Ever See It

organizations.name: new york historical society will display the world

text: The New York Historical Society Will Display the World's Most Valuable Coin While this is a really amazing piece of history finally coming around, peep how this coin (and no doubt the others) will be 100 dollar coins . Fam, when have you EVER seen a $100 coin in circulation? It's probably something dope to have as a collector, but will the bodega on the corner take my $100 coin? Do note that this isn't the first time a person of color was on legal U.S. tender; the Sacagawea one dollar coin has been in circulation since 2000. As CNN points out , there are only two coins with women on them in circulation. Whatever the case may be, if you want one of these Lady Liberty coins, make sure you're keeping your eyes peeled for its release on April 6. Watch Now
